**Company Overview: Radical**

Founded in 2022 and part of Y Combinator's Batch W23, Radical is on a mission to redefine aerial capabilities with their high-altitude, solar-powered aircraft. These innovative machines fly at an impressive 70,000 feet and operate autonomously in the stratosphere. Radical's technology has the potential to revolutionize various sectors by providing reliable cell service, capturing multi-spectral imagery, and deploying sensors for weather and climate monitoring.

The essence of Radical can be distilled down to three core functions: connectivity, observation, and sensing—all delivered from the stratosphere. This approach not only offers unprecedented observational capabilities but does so at a low cost and with zero emissions, prioritizing sustainability in a field traditionally reliant on fossil fuels.

Led by a small but capable team of two, Radical's founders previously collaborated for six years on the development of Amazon's delivery drones, bringing extensive experience to their current venture. Their group partner, Jared Friedman, lends additional expertise to the growing company.

As they carve out a niche, Radical is using advanced technology to engage with the Earth like never before. This blend of innovation and purpose positions quite well for future developments and partnerships—especially in a world increasingly driven by data and connectivity.

For more insights and updates, you can visit their website [here](https://www.radicalaero.com/) or follow them on [LinkedIn](https://www.radicalaero.com/<https:/www.linkedin.com/company/radicalaero/>) and [Twitter](https://www.radicalaero.com/<http:/twitter.com/radicalaero>). 

Radical is not just another aerospace company; it’s at the forefront of a shift towards high-altitude surveillance and ecological responsibility. Keep an eye on them—they're just getting started.
